benchmark_details.name: MULTITuDE (Multilingual Machine-Generated Text Detection Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: MULTITuDE is a novel benchmarking dataset for multilingual machine-generated text detection comprising of 74,081 authentic and machine-generated texts in 11 languages generated by 8 multilingual LLMs.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive evaluation of machine-generated text detection methods in multilingual settings.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset is limited by the selection of languages and the corresponding training samples used.

data.source: The human texts are sourced from the MassiveSumm dataset and machine-generated texts are produced by various LLMs.
data.annotation: Human texts classified as authentically written vs. machine-generated.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on model predictions over the test data.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in distinguishing machine-generated texts from human-written texts.
methodology.validation: Detected methods were validated on datasets comprising authentic and machine-generated texts.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset includes various languages, though there is a bias toward Indo-European languages.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The dataset primarily uses publicly available texts and does not intentionally collect personal data.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Usage is for non-commercial research, respecting copyright on sourced texts.
